ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Controllers

Class Claimant

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Controllers.User
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Controllers.Claimant

  • public class Claimant
extends User
    Manages Claimant specific data. Provides the ability to create and submit claims including constituent expense Items, and channel a claimant specific interface. It should be used as a way to control the interface, re: both display and functionality. Classes it works with: User, Claim, ClaimStatus,ApproverChoiceDialogFragment Sample use: Claimant c = new Claimant("name"); c.submitClaim(claim)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getButtonVisibility()
      Claimants should be able to see and use the the Create Claim button, as such it's visibility is set to VISIBLE.

      Returns the OnItemLongClickListener that the approver will see when the long-click a submitted claim.
      OnItemClickListener getClaimAdapterShortClickListener(Activity claimActivity)
      Returns the OnItemClickListener for the Claimant such that it will open the ExpenseItem creator activity.

      Gets an ArrayList of claims that the given user is allowed to see.
      static boolean isComplete(Claim claim)
      Checks each of a claim's expense items to check for incompleteness indicators.
      void submitClaim(Claim claim)
      A claim can be submitted when it has been newly created A claim can also be re-submitted when it has been returned Therefore, the claim should be able to submit when the statusEnum == RETURNED Claim can now be re-submitted after it has been returned

      • getPermittableClaims

        public java.util.ArrayList<Claim> getPermittableClaims(java.util.ArrayList<Claim> claims)
        Gets an ArrayList of claims that the given user is allowed to see. Claimants can see any claim made in their own name.
        Specified by:
        getPermittableClaims in class User

      • getClaimAdapterLongClickListener

        public OnItemLongClickListener getClaimAdapterLongClickListener(FragmentManager fm)
        Returns the OnItemLongClickListener that the approver will see when the long-click a submitted claim. Specifically it creates a new dialog that displays the options to View, edit, submit, delete.
        Specified by:
        getClaimAdapterLongClickListener in class User

      • getButtonVisibility

        public int getButtonVisibility()
